title.narrative: OUTPUT 18: COORDINATION AND EVIDENCE BUILDING

description.narrative: Stronger policy frameworks, coordination mechanism, and evidence-generation for improved equity and learning in the education sector., which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Access To Quality Learning Opportunities (Covid), Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Harnessing Power Of Business And Markets, Innovation, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, more girls and boys in Ghana are supported to complete quality and inclusive basic education with improved learning outcomes

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Stronger policy frameworks, coordination mechanism, and evidence-generation for improved equity and learning in the educationsector.

description.narrative: UNICEF’s collaboration with the Mastercard Foundation (MCF) and GES, ensured implementation of the national distance learning programme. Sixty (F:12) national trainers equipped cascading the decentralized awareness/planning for education in emergency(EIE) content. ;;To complement MoE’s administrative data for robust evidence, MoE/GES were introduced to the Multiple Cluster Indicators Education Analysis for Global Learning and Equity(MICS EAGLE), as additional data source (equity-lens) for effective data analysis and interpretation. ;;The National Teacher Policy is available.; Through the development process, corporation amongst international partners like UNESCO, ILO, WB, UNHCR, GPE and Education International on teacher issues has been strengthened in Ghana. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:24/12/2021
